description: On Monday, Prime Minister Boris Johnson of Britain was questioned about the recent claims made by Queen Elizabeth’s grandson Prince Harry and his wife, Meghan.
title: Boris Johnson Refuses to Discuss Royal Family Drama
title_page: Boris Johnson Refuses to Discuss Royal Family Drama - The New York Times
maintext: Perhaps the best thing I can say is that I’ve always had the highest admiration for the queen, and the unifying role that she plays in our country and across the Commonwealth. And as for the rest, all other matters to do with the royal family, I’ve spent a long time now not commenting on royal family matters, and I don’t intend to depart from that today. I congratulate you on your very determined attempt to involve me in this story more than I’ve said all already. But I really think that when it comes to matters to do with the royal family, the right thing for prime ministers to say is, is nothing. And nothing is the thing that I propose to say today about that, about that particular matter.
